message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE, cs.SY

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) as it discusses the use of Network Function Virtualization (NFV) to improve the delivery of content over the Internet. It could also belong to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) as it proposes an architecture for on-the-fly component provisioning in Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), which are distributed systems. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of microservices, which could place it in the cs.SE (Software Engineering) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes an architecture for tackling issues such as flash crowds, which could place it in the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
